org.propelgraph

Interface OptionalMethodVerifier

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CollaborativeFilterSupport

    public interface OptionalMethodVerifier
    This interface allows the caller to check if the implementation of a generic interface has really implemented a method of that interface. This saves the caller from having to surround every call to that method with a try-catch block for the UnsupportedMethodException.
    Author:
    ccjason (11/7/2014)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Iterable<Vertex> simpleCF(Direction dirHop1, String label)
      This method implements a very simple form of collaborative filtering.
      boolean supportedMethod(String methodid)
      Returns true if the specified method is supported.

    • Method Detail

      • supportedMethod

        boolean supportedMethod(String methodid)
        Returns true if the specified method is supported. This allows the caller to check if a particular method is supported. The interface or class that declares that method should define the static final String that the caller should pass to denote a given method.
        Parameters:
        methodid - the identifier of the method being checked. For the sake of runtime performance, the implementations of this method are allowed to do simple pointer checks rather than string comparisons. Callers should pass a pointer to the declared static final value rather than pass pointers to values they've constructed.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • simpleCF

        Iterable<Vertex> simpleCF(Direction dirHop1,
                        String label)
                          throws UnsupportedMethodException
        This method implements a very simple form of collaborative filtering. This method usually would be a method on the source vertex.
        Parameters:
        dirHop1 -
        label -
        Returns:
        Set
        Throws:
        UnsupportedMethodException
